channel.title: Clouds | Template graphics!
channel.description:
[center][b]I've made a separate thread in Web Design for Web Design feedback. I'm posting here for advice and feedback on the graphics.[/b]
Anything I've done well? Anything which needs improving? I want to know!
This is a development project, and I'll be improving it with your feedback!
You can view the template [url=http://www.jamesy.net/clouds]here![/url][/center] [center]You can comment on the coding and webdev [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,242374.0.html]here[/url]![/center]

item.title: Clouds | Template graphics!
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

naw, I never tried to start a fight, you did, and now it already started.
Did you find those stuff insulting? pfft.
And did I ever say I hated it? No, I find it quite amusing but there are still stuff in it that are bothering me.
I have a feeling you’re just copying the others, seeing this is your first time seeing me in contact with you.
Your taking your surroundings to personally.

And if I were you, I would keep the designs kind of simple, but not too simple.
Try using less colors, and fill in the white with something helpful or with design or some text.
If there’s too much design, your mind may see too much, and not see it as good.
And I swear, don’t take this as an offense or I’ll get real mad:
The colors suck, not to appealing to make. Try re-arranging the colors until it’s nice to the eye and looks good.
Try making the background have a white-ish gradient, because in my mind I see that pretty good.

I would rate it 6/10, the colors need work.

Read full topic

item.title: Clouds | Template graphics!
item.dc:creator: @JV1 JV
item.description:
@JV1 wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:3, topic:181008”]1) Center the template.
2) Put a Repeat-Y on the gradient background.
3) Center the links IMO
4) Provide PSDs for banner and the buttons if your going to leave the buttons as images.

I’ll edit if I see any other problems, other then those it looks pretty good.[/quote]

I’m working on all those things now.
I’ll center the links, and make rollovers for them.

I’ve provided the PSD’s so it can be edited etc though.

[quote=“nator123123, post:5, topic:181008”]I’m guessing your a beginner.
Or you suck at website making.
I agree with all of the others, especially the centering and the repeatings :O[/quote]

I’m sorry, please gtfo. There is absolutely no point in this post. You haven’t left help, and IMO, you’re just trying to start a fight.

Even though I doubt you can make a better one, would you mind linking me some of your website designs, templates, or pages?
And hey, if I’m wrong, you get the last laugh. (Y)

[quote=“goatee, post:2, topic:181008”]Detail…sure its all good and dandy for a template but for a design it just isn’t good enough to make someone go “Wow!”.

I personally love little bits of attention to detail in designs, lines, small marks or smudges, colours all make it for me. You have the normal template design, but nothing special in the graphics department.[/quote]

This isn’t the finished article, I’m posting it now for helpful advice like this. I’m going to develop this template according to your feedback.

I’ll try focusing on a few more tiny details over the holiday.
It’s the little things that make the big things happen, eh?

exe626:

…You should center it. The design itself is alright though, I just don’t favor the sickly blue color.

Thankyou
I’ll see if I can find an alternative to the blue. Any ideas?

Read full topic

item.title: Clouds | Template graphics!
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

  1. Center the template.
  2. Put a Repeat-Y on the gradient background.
  3. Center the links IMO
  4. Provide PSDs for banner and the buttons if your going to leave the buttons as images.

I’ll edit if I see any other problems, other then those it looks pretty good.

Read full topic

item.title: Clouds | Template graphics!
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Detail…sure its all good and dandy for a template but for a design it just isn’t good enough to make someone go “Wow!”.

I personally love little bits of attention to detail in designs, lines, small marks or smudges, colours all make it for me. You have the normal template design, but nothing special in the graphics department.

Read full topic
